message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO 

This paper presents a novel framework for producing pixel-wise segmentations using minimal supervision, specifically 2D point supervision. The focus is on segmentation tasks in video and volumetric image data, which suggests a strong connection to computer vision (cs.CV). The method relies on learning object-image-specific features and using these in a semi-supervised learning framework, which suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions image modalities such as video and 3D volumes, which suggests a connection to multimedia (cs.MM) and robotics (cs.RO).
